trans-unit.source: Provides support for the behavior that enables Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) endpoints to receive HTTP requests from a browser-based ASP.NET AJAX client.
This class cannot be inherited.

When applied to an endpoint, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior> behavior enables [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] and ASP.NET AJAX integration, except for the support required for JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) encoding.

Various types of encoding, including JSON, are enabled by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebMessageEncodingElement> or by an appropriately configured <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior> behavior implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> and inherits from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior>, which enables the more general Web programming model for [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services exposing non-SOAP endpoints.
Specifically, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior>:
Enables the HTTP programming model, including dispatch to operations based on a URL suffix, support for HTTP verb selection (POST or GET) and HTTP cache duration control.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] the HTTP programming model, see [WCF Web HTTP Programming Model Overview](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-web-http-programming-model-overview.md).
Note that the default HTTP verb is POST when using this behavior.
Enables the correct formatter for each operation's request and response messages - for example, support for URL parameters.
Enables the JavaScript Proxy endpoint.

To call a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service from an ASP.NET AJAX client, the service must be configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> binding and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior> must be added to the endpoint behavior collection.

This can be done either in configuration by adding the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebScriptEnablingElement> or without using configuration by activating the AJAX endpoint with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.WebScriptServiceHostFactory> instead of the default factory in the [@ServiceHost](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf-directive/servicehost.md) directive in the .svc file.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] different ways to enable a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service to respond to ASP.NET AJAX clients, see [Creating WCF Services for ASP.NET AJAX](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/creating-wcf-services-for-aspnet-ajax.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior"></xref> class.
Sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior.DefaultBodyStyle%2A> to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.WrappedRequest> value.

Sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior.DefaultOutgoingRequestFormat%2A> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior.DefaultOutgoingResponseFormat%2A> to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.WrappedRequest> value.
Applies the behavior to the client across an endpoint.

Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior.ApplyClientBehavior%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime%29> method to view, modify, or add custom extension to the client runtime across all messages used with an endpoint or for specific operations.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> that exposes the contract.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime"></xref> to which the custom behavior is applied.
Applies the behavior to the service endpoint.
Normally, this method is called by [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] automatically when the behavior is applied to an endpoint.
So there is no need to call this method manually.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> that exposes the contract.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher"></xref> to which the custom behavior is applied.
Gets or sets a value that determines if automatic format selection is enabled.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] automatic format selection, see [WCF Web HTTP Formatting](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-web-http-formatting.md).
`true` if automatic format selection is enabled; otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets the default message body style.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.WrappedRequest> value is the only <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle> supported and setting any other value results in a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> being thrown.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.WrappedRequest"></xref> value.
This default value is the only valid value.
The body style set is not supported.
Gets or sets the default outgoing request message format.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref> used by outgoing request messages.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat.Json"></xref>.
The message format set is not a valid value of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref>.
Gets and sets the default outgoing response message format.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref> used by outgoing response messages.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat.Json"></xref>.
The message format set is not a valid value of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref>.
Gets or sets the flag that specifies whether a FaultException is generated when an internal server error (HTTP status code: 500) occurs.
Returns `true` if the flag is enabled; otherwise returns `false`.
Gets or sets a value that determines if the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] REST Help page is enabled.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] REST Help page, see [WCF Web HTTP Service Help Page](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-web-http-service-help-page.md).
`true` if the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] REST Help page is enabled; otherwise `false`.
Confirms that the endpoint meets the requirements that allow it to function as an ASP.NET AJAX endpoint.

Verifies that the endpoint is not `null`, uses the HTTP or HTTPS schemes, does not use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>, uses either the HTTP GET or POST verb, that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> of the binding is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.None%2A>, and that the binding contains a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement> where <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.ManualAddressing%2A> is set to `true`.
This method also checks that there are no SOAP headers or wrapper names on the methods, or other unsupported aspects of the operations.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> that exposes the contract.
The endpoint does not meet one of the requirements for being an ASP.NET AJAX endpoint.
